quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Fidel Castro and Menachem Begin
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, leader, gon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who became leader of Cuba after a coup d etat in 1940?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fulgencio Batista

questions.question: When did Menachem Begin become the first Likud Prime Minister of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1977

questions.question: Where was the failed attack on the Cuban army, led by Fidel Castro in 1953?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moncada Barracks

questions.question: What Zionist group did Menachem Begin join in 1942?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irgun

questions.question: Which famous American wrote the song A Hard Rains a-Gonna Fall at the height of the Cuban Missile Crisis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

questions.question: What was the aim of Altalena Affair that took place in June, 1948?

options.text: to stop military equipment from reaching Israel

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The 6th Prime Minister of Israel, Menachem Wolfovitch Begin was born in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1913

questions.question: Menachem Begin was a member of the Betar Movement, which is what kind of organization?

options.text: An organization begun in Warsaw  that fought against anti-semites in Russia
A Zionist youth group formed in 1929 at first to defend Jewish youth in Poland and then throughout Europe
An organization formed by Begin to help the legal and  political status of Jews in Poland
An organization whose aim was to bring as many  European Jewish youth to Israel as was  possible.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Zionist youth group formed in 1929 at first to defend Jewish youth in Poland and then throughout Europe

questions.question: When did Fidel Castro and his group assume power?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1959

questions.question: Why  was Menachem Begin released  from Siberia in 1941?

options.text: He was not released. He escaped and made his way to Turkey and then to Israel.
Stalin personally required his knowledge and  abilities
Because of the the Sikorski-Mayski Agreement

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of the the Sikorski-Mayski Agreement

questions.question: What settled the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis?

options.text: Russia took away its battleships from Cuba  and the USA removed its carriers from the North Sea.
Russia took away its jet fighters from Cuba and the USA removed their jet fighters from Finland and Holland.
Russia removed its missiles in Cuba and the US Army withdrew soldiers from West Germany.
Russia took away the missiles in Cuba and the USA took away its missiles and spy equipment  in Turkey

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russia took away the missiles in Cuba and the USA took away its missiles and spy equipment  in Turkey

questions.question: What honor did Fidel Castro win in 1944?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Best Cuban Athlete

questions.question: The right-wing Israeli political party Likud was formed in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1965

questions.question: Which statement is not true?

options.text: One of Fidel Castros top aides was Che Guevara.
Fidel Castro was the longest reigning ruler of the 20th century
Religion is greatly oppressed in Cuba.
In 2005 and 2006, Forbes magazine claimed that Fidel Castro was worth between $500 million and $900 million.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Religion is greatly oppressed in Cuba.

questions.question: Why did the USA declare an embargo on all trade to and from Cuba on October 27, 1962?

options.text: The American mob had been forced to leave Cuba.
American spy planes found Russian battleships in Cuba.
American spy planes found Russian fighter jets in Cuba.
American spy planes found Russian-made missiles in Cuba.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American spy planes found Russian-made missiles in Cuba.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: George Washington and President

questions.question: This socialite, model actress, singer, fashion designer said Dress cute wherever you go, life is too short to blend in.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: England and Bermuda Triangle
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, welsh. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What famous pirate was arrested and conducted to the Kingdom of England in 1672 because he violated a peace treaty between England and Spain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Morgan

questions.question: The loss of this US vessel with all 306 crew and passengers in 1918 was credited to the Bermuda Triangle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USS Cyclops

questions.question: The Bermuda Triangle is located in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What Steven Spielberg film suggests that Flight 19 was abducted by aliens?

options.text: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.question: It was proven in the 1980s that some of the Bermuda Triangle incidents were related to compass problems.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Bermuda Triangle area is among the most heavily-sailed shipping lanes in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the 1970s, American author and pilot Larry Kusche made the following conclusion regarding the Bermuda Triangle.

options.text: Most of the incidents had been caused by storms or accidents.
Some of the incidents credited to the Triangle actually happened far from the Triangle.
The Triangle was a manufactured mystery.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This famous English pirate and politician of the Elizabethan era sailed around the world, returning to England in 1580.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Drake

questions.question: Ching Shih was a prominent Chinese female pirate active during what century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 19th

questions.question: This Welsh privateer was knighted in 1674 and the following year he took up the post of Lieutenant Governor of Jamaica.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Morgan

questions.question: Why were popular female pirates Аnne Bonny and Mary Read not executed after they were captured?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: because they were pregnant

questions.question: In what year did Flight 19, a training flight of TBM Avenger bombers, go missing while over the Atlantic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1945

questions.question: What legendary French corsair was nicknamed King of Corsairs due to his gallantry and chivalry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Surcouf

questions.question: Edgar Cayce, who was believed to be psychic, suggested that the Bermuda Triangle was the location of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlantis

questions.question: The disappearance of Theodosia Burr Alston, daughter of former US Vice President Aaron Burr, has been cited in relation to the Bermuda Triangle. She was a passenger aboard what ship when she disappeared?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Patriot

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Ted Kennedy and Meaning
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Ted Kennedy was approached by the Green Bay Packers to play professional football.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Hebrew name Elizabeth, Elisabeth or Elisheva?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My God is an oath.

questions.question: What aircraft disappeared in 1948 while on a flight from San Juan, Puerto Rico, to Miami?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Douglas DC-3

questions.question: From the floor of the Senate, Ted Kennedy described this mans America as one in which women would be forced into back-alley abortions, blacks would sit at segregated lunch counters, rouge police could break down citizens doors in midnight raids......the doors of the Federal courts would be shut on the fingers of millions of citizens. Who was the nominee to the U. S. Supreme Court that was the subject of Kennedys speech?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Bork

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Hebrew name Michael?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Who is like God?

questions.question: Senator Ted Kennedy made a sudden, dramatic appearance in the summer of 2008 to cast the decisive vote for a cause he had fought for during his senate career. For what cause did Senator Kennedy come to vote Aye?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Medicare

questions.question: In April 2009, Senator Ted Kennedy was asked to throw out the ceremonial first pitch on opening day for this major league team. In what stadium would you be sitting to watch Senator Kennedys first pitch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fenway Park

questions.question: Ted Kennedys hopes for becoming President of the United States were dealt a crushing blow on the night of July 18, 1969 in the swirling waters off Dike Bridge. Who was the young girl who died that night in an accident that is known as the Chappaquiddick incident?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Jo Kopechne

questions.question: Although Ted Kennedy enjoyed great success in the Senate, his behavior in his personal life
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Kennedy Smith

questions.question: What does the Hebrew name Isaac mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Laughter

questions.question: Who was Ted Kennedy speaking of with these lines, He had every gift but length of years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John F. Kennedy, Jr

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Hebrew name Sarah?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Princess

questions.question: Senator Ted Kennedys Irish inherent eloquence made him a powerful orator, none more so than when he delivered these words need not be idealized, or enlarged in death beyond what he was in life; to be remembered simply as a good and decent man, who saw wrong and tried to right it, saw suffering and tried to heal it, saw war and tried to stop it. Who was eulogized in Senator Kennedys speech?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert F. Kennedy

questions.question: For me, a few hours ago, this campaign came to an end. For all those whose care have been our concern, the work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dream shall never die. These are words from Ted Kennedys concession speech after his failed run for the 1980 Democratic nomination for President of the United States. Who defeated Kennedy in his only bid for the Presidency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

questions.question: Who delivered the eulogy at Senator Ted Kennedy funeral?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: President Obama
